intro: Ligusticum tachiroei, commonly known as Tachiroe Ligusticum, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
